definition: Zhang Tianyi (1906-1985), children's writer, author of prize-winning fairy tale Secret of the Magic Gourd 寶葫蘆的秘密|宝葫芦的秘密[Bao3 hu2 lu5 de5 Mi4 mi4]
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
day/sky/heaven
wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)

sentences.english: Zhang Tianyi's novels exhibit his unique satirical art style.
sentences.chinese: 张天翼的讽刺小说显示了特独的艺术个性。

sentences.english: This text has analyzed the difference of personage's character in the works of two writers emphatically.
sentences.chinese: 本文简要分析了老舍与张天翼笔下人物的不同点。

sentences.english: Section two analyzes the satire art of Zhang Tianyi's satire novel.
sentences.chinese: 第二部分分析张天翼讽刺小说的讽刺艺术。

definition: Xiao Qian (1910-1999), Mongolian-born, Cambridge-educated journalist active during Second World War in Europe, subsequently famous author and translator
Ye Yonglie (1940-), popular science writer
Ding Ling (1904-1986), female novelist, author of novel The Sun Shines over the Sanggan River 太陽照在桑乾河上|太阳照在桑干河上, attacked during the 1950s as anti-Party
Ye Shengtao (1894-1988), writer and editor, known esp. for children's books
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Ru Zhijuan (1925-1998), female novelist and politician
Xu Dishan (1893-1941), journalist, publisher and novelist
Xia Yan (1900-1995), Chinese writer, playwright, socialist critic and movie pioneer
Yao Xueyin (1910-1999), PRC novelist, author of historical novel Li Zicheng 李自成
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Deng Tuo (1912-1966), sociologist and journalist, died under persecution at the start of the Cultural Revolution/wrote under the pen name Ma Nancun 馬南邨|马南邨
Liu Xinwu (1942-), novelist
editor/compiler
Ai Qing (1910-1996), Chinese poet
Sun Li (1913-2002), novelist
